Alumni Scholarship Fund

The Alumni Gives Scholarship allows students to pursue their dreams and contribute to the technology community.  This needs-based scholarship empowers students to overcome financial hurdles while pursuing their education goals and gives preference to underrepresented populations within the CCI student body.
To make a gift, click the link below and search for CCI Alumni Gives Back Scholarship in the Designations menu.
Degree Requirements
Requirements for MS Cybersecurity and MS Information Technology
MS Cybersecurity
MS Cybersecurity requires the successful completion of 30 credit hours of graduate course work (see the MS Cybersecurity Catalog for courses and course descriptions).

Core (12 credit hours)
Cybersecurity Electives (15 credit hours)
Free Elective (3 credit hours)
Culminating Experience (0-6 credit hours)
Core Component
Students are required to complete the following core courses:

ITIS 5250 Computer Forensics
ITS 6167 Network Security
ITIS 6200 Information Security and Privacy
ITIS 6240 Applied Cryptography
Cybersecurity Culminating Experience
All students will complete a culminating experience as a capstone demonstrating mastery in Cybersecurity. This requirement is satisfied by completing one of the following capstones:

Cybersecurity Project Report: written report on knowledge relating one or more courses to a IT project (0 credit hours)
Cybersecurity Internship Project (3 credits) Students who choose to complete the Internship Project for their culminating experience will use ITIS 6198 Internship Project course (3 credit hours) to help fulfill the cybersecurity elective requirements
Cybersecurity Master’s Thesis (total 6 credit hours: 3 credits each semester across 2 semesters)
Free Elective Component
Students may complete any additional course offered by the College of Computing and Informatics (BINF, HCIP, ITCS, ITIS) for their remaining elective requirement.
MS Information Technology
MS Information Technology requires successful completion of 30 credit hours of graduate course work (see the MSIT Catalog for courses and course descriptions).

Core (15 credit hours)
Concentration (9 credit hours)
Electives (6 credit hours)
IT Culminating Experience
Core Component
Students are required to complete the following core requirements: 1. Advanced Programming: Select 1 from the following 2 courses

ITIS 5166 Network-Based Application Development
ITIS 5180 Mobile Application Development
2. Databases: Select 1 from the following 2 courses

ITIS 6120 Applied Databases
IT IS 6162 Knowledge Discovery from Databases
3. Software Systems Design: Select 1 from the following 3 courses:

ITIS 6112 Software System Design and Implementation
ITIS 6342 Information Technology Project Management
ITIS 6177 System Integration
4. ITIS 6200 Principles of Information Security and Privacy 5. ITIS 6300 Principles of Human Computer Interaction
Concentration Component

MSIT students are required to select and complete one of the following concentration options. Students pursuing a MS thesis for their culminating experience will use 6 credit hours towards their concentration in place of coursework. Subject to the approval of the Graduate Program Director, a course from outside of the approved list may be taken as a substitute course for the concentration. MSIT program offers the following concentrations: 1. Advanced Data and Knowledge Discovery 2. Emerging Technologies 3. Human-Computer Interaction 4. Information Security and Privacy 5. Information Technology Management 6. Software Systems Design and Engineering 7. Web Development
Elective Component

Students fulfill the remaining requirements for a MSIT degree by completing two approved elective courses in the area of information technology. Students who chose to complete the IT Internship Project for their culminating experience will enroll in ITIS 6198 Internship Project course (3 credit hours) to help fulfill the elective requirements.
MSIT Culminating Experience
All students will complete a culminating experience as a capstone demonstrating mastery in IT. This requirement is satisfied by completing one of the following capstones:

IT Project Report: written report on knowledge relating one or more courses to a IT project (0 credit hours)
IT Internship Project (3 credits)
IT Master’s Thesis (total 6 credit hours: 3 credits each semester across 2 semesters)
